summary.para: Initializes the speech-related user interface elements on the TSF language bar.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: The standard speech text service usually initializes the speech-related user interface on the TSF language bar. When a TSF-enabled application, that does not use the speech text service, requires use of the interface, it initializes the user interface with this method.

summary.para: Sets the visibility state of the speech-related user interface elements on the TSF language bar.

param.name: fShow
param.para: Specifies whether to show (TRUE) or not show (FALSE) the speech-related user interface elements.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Sets the style and text of the speech balloon on the TSF language bar.

param.name: style
param.para: Contains a element that specifies the balloon style.

param.name: pch
param.para: Pointer to a zero-terminated Unicode string that contains the text to show in the balloon.

param.name: cch
param.para: Specifies the number of characters in the string of the pch parameter.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: The ITfSpeechUIServer interface manages the speech-related user interface on the TSF language bar.

remarks.para: The user interface elements on the TSF language bar managed by this interface include the microphone button, the speech configuration menu button, the dictation button, the command button, and the speech balloon. The standard speech text service usually manages these user interface elements in an application, including initialization. This type of application does not require the ITfSpeechUIServer interface.

An application that does not use the speech text service might require use of the features provided by the speech-related interface elements. In that case, the following code example shows how an application can obtain a pointer to the ITfSpeechUIServer interface by calling the function with the CLSID_SpeechUIServer CLSID.
Subsequently, the application can use the method to initialize the user interface and the other methods of the ITfSpeechUIServer interface to manage the user interface.
